About.name: University of Derby
About.about:
Located in the heart of England, we are the only university in Derbyshire. We combine teaching excellence, research innovation and industry engagement to create an inspiring learning experience, and were proudly awarded Gold in the prestigious Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) 2023, making us one of the top universities in the country recognised for outstanding student experience and student outcomes.
Ranked 2nd for employability and course quality, and a Top 10 university overall in the Uni Compare Student Review Rankings 2026, we are focused on preparing students for a successful future. 96% of our UK graduates are in employment or further study (HESA Graduate Outcomes 2021/22).
Derby has a long-standing reputation for extraordinary innovation which we aim to build upon, using our knowledge to support the prosperity of our region, nation and the world. We partner for impact, meaning we are committed to creating a collaborative environment where graduate talent can flourish.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
We are a problem centric, solution focused University with a strong philosophy around shaping tomorrow, today.
Our students, graduates and staff are making an impact in our region and around the world by using their expertise and experience to drive innovation and make positive changes. You can be part of that story.
We are continuously investing in our facilities and will soon be adding a £14.4 million Bioscience Superlab. A brand-new state-of-the-art Business School is also set to open near the city centre as a modern, zero carbon hub for students and start-up companies to learn, network and prosper.
The University of Derby ranked in the Top 15 for satisfaction with feedback in the Guardian University Guide 2025 and Top 20 for overall assessment and feedback in the National Student Survey 2024.
We have a strong awareness of our environmental impact and we aim to bring sustainability into all aspects of our teaching, research, operational and international activities.

courseLocations.address: St. Helena, Sheffield Road, Chesterfield, S41 7LU

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: Want to know the best thing about Derby? There really is something for everyone! Derby seamlessly blends the fast-paced city life with beautiful countryside, meaning whether you’re an adventure-seeker, a nature-lover or a sports-enthusiast, you’ll find incredible experiences on your doorstep.
We have a thriving Union of Students which sits at the heart of the student experience providing endless opportunities to socialise with new, like-minded friends, volunteer and play sport.

Budgeting while at university couldn't be easier with our fixed price accommodation. Your gas, electricity and water bills, along with superfast Wi-Fi are all included in your rent meaning you can enjoy peace of mind with no unexpected charges.
Awarded Best University Housing for three years running and Best Environmental Management for two years running, as voted for by students in the Global Student Living Awards 2024.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in East Midlands?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: The East Midlands comprises five counties, with its main cities being Derby, Leicester, Lincoln and Nottingham.

The region has plenty of history, boasting both the world’s first factory and its first pub (allegedly). It also has many castles, cathedrals and stately homes, including Chatsworth House, which has served as the backdrop to period films like Jane Eyre and Pride and Prejudice.

And, of course, you’ll find the gorgeous Peak District here. If you end up studying in the East Midlands, definitely make a trip to explore its rolling green hills, peatlands, and quaint market towns – like Buxton, the caverns of Castleton, and Bakewell (home of the famous tart).

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in Derby ?Check out our city guide
paragraphs: Discover Derby – a compact, affordable city with a proud industrial heritage and a supportive, welcoming student community.

campusParagraphs: The University of Derby is spread across several teaching and learning sites, located in or near the city centre.

Our main site is at Kedleston Road and features a £17.6m Bioscience Superlab and Research Lab, an outstanding Sports Centre, a four-storey library, a Multi-faith Centre and the Union of Students. You’ll also find lots of popular eateries including Starbucks and Subway.
The Cavenidish Building is our new £75m home to Derby Business School; a hub where students and businesses can co-locate, share knowledge, gain skills and collaborate to help solve global challenges.
The University of Derby also has a site in Chesterfield which is recognised as a Centre of Excellence for health and social care.

There are six undergraduate halls offering a range of accommodation to suit all budgets. Halls are arranged in flats for 4-6 people and all residents have access to free or low cost Residence Life events and activities. Each hall has a common room, laundry and outside space.

courseLocations.title: Chesterfield - St Helena
courseLocations.address: St. Helena, Sheffield Road, Chesterfield, S41 7LU

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: We offer an exciting range of undergraduate courses in a variety of subjects, with options to study full-time, part-time, on-campus or online.

You will be taught by industry experts in first-class facilities to develop all the right knowledge and skills for the workplace of the future. We are consistently recognised for the high quality of our teaching and we use our strong industry links to help you apply your learning through practical, real world experiences.

Our Initial Teacher Education programmes at the University of Derby have been rated as ‘Outstanding’ in the latest Ofsted report. We're also in the Top 15 for satisfaction with feedback in the Guardian University Guide 2025, and Top 20 for overall assessment and feedback in the National Student Survey 2024.
Within all our courses, we have a strong emphasis on employability and are proud to say that 96% of our UK graduates are in employment or further study (HESA Graduate Outcomes 21/22).

Apprenticeships.heading: Apprenticeships
paragraphs: At the University of Derby, our degree apprenticeship programmes are underpinned by academic excellence, research innovation and industry engagement to create multi-skilled employees who are prepared for the workplace. You’ll become immersed in a practical learning experience where you’ll have opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and resilience to forge a successful career and make a positive impact within our society.

We’re partnering with business leaders from across the region, including Rolls-Royce, to ensure our programmes meet their evolving sector needs, meaning you can be sure that your qualification and experience will help you stand out in a crowded job market.

International.heading: International
paragraphs: At the University of Derby we welcome more than 1,700 students from 100 countries who study at both undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Based in the multi-cultural city of Derby, in the heart of England, we have strong connections with local businesses and industry. We use these links to provide applied, industry-relevant opportunities across a range of subjects, from science, engineering and health care to arts, education, humanities, law and business.
Career support

Many of our courses are professionally accredited to give you the best possible start to your career. We also offer expert career advice and a range of placements and internships to build your experience and increase your employability.
Academic expertise

Our teaching team combine industry experience with academic expertise, and many are also distinguished researchers in their field. This means that we a strong reputation for our teaching quality, and have been rated:
We are also ranked in the top 800 universities in the world in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2021.
Campus and city

Our campus is spread across several sites in Derby, all close to each other, student accommodation and the city centre, and there’s a Unibus service available.  Our award-winning accommodation provides a great way to live in a safe environment with everything you need close by. You’ll soon feel settled and make new friends through events and activities organised by the accommodation team.

The city itself is compact and easy to get around, offering plenty to see and do for all tastes. It has Purple Flag status, recognising its safe, varied and entertaining night-time entertainment, and is close to beautiful countryside and attractions including stately homes and theme parks.

Superb teaching facilities at all of our sites provide industry-standard equipment to help you develop the most up-to-date skills in your chosen discipline. These include our STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths) Centre with the latest facilities for computing, technology and engineering; music production and creative studios at Markeaton Street, and hi-tech clinical skills facilities at Kedleston Road.
Scholarships, bursaries and discounts

We offer a range of scholarships, bursaries and discounts to our international students to help with the costs of studying with us. They include our £2,000 Postgraduate (PGT) Scholarship, which is awarded automatically to most international students, subject to eligibility.
Support

There’s a variety of support on offer to help you with your application and during your time as a student with us. This includes visa advice, and a meet and greet service from selected airports. We can also help you to develop your English language skills, either before you start your course or while you are studying. There’s also a Multi-Faith Centre, doctor’s surgery and wellbeing centre to take care of both your spiritual and physical needs.
lists: 11th in the UK for overall satisfaction, Postgraduate Taught Experience Survey 2021
Top 20 for satisfaction with teaching, Postgraduate Taught Experience Survey 2021
Top 10 in the world for international learning experience, Global International Student Barometer 2018
Number 1 for multicultral learning, UK ISB Benchmark Group 2018

StudentSupport.heading: Student support
paragraphs: Prioritising your health and wellbeing

We offer tailored support packages for students with disabilities, including specific learning difficulties and mental health diagnoses as well as care leavers, estranged students and those with caring responsibilities or money worries. You can opt for a one-to-one appointment, attend a workshop, a group session, or access our online resources – whatever would make you feel most comfortable. You can also book an appointment with one of our support advisors before you start your studies so that we can make sure any adaptations are put in place ready for your arrival.
Equality, diversity and inclusion

We believe our diverse community is what makes the University of Derby such a special place to be. We are proud to welcome and celebrate students, staff and visitors from all walks of life, and seek to provide a positive environment where everyone has the freedom to express their true self. We do this through student-led societies, staff-led networks, campus celebration events and raising equality awareness. We operate a strict zero tolerance policy which covers all forms of discrimination.
Multi-Faith Centre

Kedleston Road is home to our Multi-Faith Centre where a team of friendly chaplains and faith consultants support students with their religious beliefs. The centre welcomes all students and offers a safe, peaceful and private space to meditate, pray or just escape the day.
Cost of living

Derby has been named the third most affordable UK city for students* but here at the University, we are going one step further to help ease your worries around money. Our fixed price accommodation comes with all-inclusive bills meaning there are no hidden costs to worry about. If you are looking for tips and tricks to make your money go further, you can speak to our Student Money Advisers in the Student Life team for their tried and tested budgeting advice.
Disability support

At the University, we provide bespoke support to all students with disabilities such as arranging accommodation that has been adapted to suit specific needs. The Disabled Students’ Allowance (DSA) is available as a non-repayable grant that can help you get the best out of your educational experience. It can be used to cover the cost of specialist equipment, a mentor or interpreter.
